lines:
1956

June 24, 1911,

TO WHOM IT MAY CONCEAN:

The bearer of this note, Mr. S. S. Kwan, has been a 
student at Phillips Acadeny during the past three years. He is returning

to China this summer at his father's request to revisit his home, and ex -
pects to resume his studies at Andover in the Fall.

He is a boy of most

excellent character and is entitled to the fullest measure of confidence

and trust,
raw: 1956 June 24, 1911, TO WHOM IT MAY CONCEAN: The bearer of this note, Mr. S. S. Kwan, has been a student at Phillips Acadeny during the past three years. He is returning to China this summer at his father's request to revisit his home, and expects to resume his studies at Andover in the Fall. He is a boy of most excellent character and is entitled to the fullest measure of confidence and trust,

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Letter stating that S. Kwan has been a student at Phillips Academy for three years, returning to China for the summer, and then to Andover in the fall. He is a student of excellent character.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
